alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:09PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rock Island, southwestern Whiteside, northwestern Henry, Scott, northeastern Muscatine and southeastern Clinton Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 408 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Donahue to near Andalusia. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Davenport, Eldridge and Long Grove around 420 PM CDT. Milan and Oak Grove around 425 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include McCausland, Bettendorf, Riverdale, East Moline, Coal Valley, Hampton, Princeton, Le Claire, Rapids City, Warner, Colona, Port Byron, Cordova and Erie. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 280 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 23. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 16. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 20. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
